text: Thought it'd be funny to pretend to propose to my girlfriend with a Haribo ring. She said yes and got so excited before I could explain it was a joke. Panicked, and bought a real ring the same afternoon. Been married 14 years today. Never wanted to marry her in the first place.

I enjoy a cup of Bovril on a cold night but went to make one just there and I've run out. All I had was a tub of 'Pigs in Blankets' Bistro granules that are a year out of date. So I'm sitting here drinking a mugful of bacon flavored gravy. It's surprisingly nice.

Up until the age of 27 I thought the word knackered was spelt NAKED. Day to day this wasn't a huge problem. But sometimes I would text people and say something like 'I'm not going out, I am totally naked. You can come round here if you like?'

Chemistry teacher told us that stomach acid is hydrochloric acid. I assumed that meant I could try drinking some. Trip to hospital with acid burns in mouth. Bad experience. Would not recommend. I learned a lesson that I expect most people don't feel the need to learn.

Was charged £48 for excess baggage by airline. Have just submitted a pile of subject access and freedom of information requests to said airline's legal/data protection team. Confident it'll cost them more than £48 in staff time to respond. I live for this pettiness. Cunts.

English, grew up in Malaysia. I played ping pong with a Chinese kid called Dennis. He didn't speak English and my Hokkien was bad. It dawned on me about 15 years later he was probably saying 'tennis'. Fucking mortified.

I am the pianist for an Anglican Church. I always position the grand piano so that it's a slight squeeze for some people when they come back round from communion. I could make the gap bigger, but then I'd lose my little bit of Sunday morning entertainment.
Tried to flirt with the bartender all night, but they were just being friendly. Now I'm embarrassed every time I walk into that bar.
Sent a flirty text to the wrong person and now I have to explain myself to my boss. Nothing like mixing business with pleasure... or disaster.
Wore mismatched shoes to a date and didn't realize it until halfway through the evening. She still loves me... I think.
Attempted to do a romantic dance with my partner, but stepped on their toes repeatedly. Still danced, but more carefully.
Tried to impress my friends by doing a backflip at a party. Landed face-first in the punch bowl. At least my friends are now calling me 'The Splash'.
Bought a fancy bottle of wine to impress my date, but spilled it as soon as we opened it. Cheers to bad luck.
Wore a flashy belt to a dinner date to show my style, but it was too flashy and distracted from the conversation.
Tried to serenade my crush with a guitar song, but forgot the lyrics and ended up singing nonsense. She laughed and gave me a thumbs up.
Bought matching outfits with my date to show our connection, but the colors clashed terribly. We still love each other though.
Attempted to juggle wine glasses at a party to impress my friends, but ended up knocking one over. Now I'm known as the 'Juggler of Spills'.
Wore a see-through shirt to a club to show off my new tattoos. Forgot it was too transparent. Had to cover up quickly.
Tried to be smooth by offering my jacket to a stranger, but realized too late it was my only jacket. They stayed warm though.
Wore a fake mustache to a costume party, but it kept falling off and revealing my identity. Mission failed.
Tried to impress my date with my cooking skills, but the meal was a disaster. We ordered takeout and laughed about it.
Bought a romantic playlist for dinner, but accidentally played heavy metal instead. Date thought it was a joke.
Attempted to flirt with someone at the gym, but tripped on the treadmill and face-planted. Still gym buddies now.
Wore a funny hat to a date to break the ice, but it was too funny and overshadowed the conversation.
Tried to impress by showing off my dance moves at a party, but stepped on someone's foot instead. Now I'm known as 'The Foot Stealer'.
Sent a romantic message to my crush, but autocorrect changed it to something awkward. Now I have to explain the typo.
Tried to take a romantic walk on the beach, slipped on the sand, and face-planted into the water. Wet and embarrassed.
Wore bright red pants to a job interview to stand out. They certainly stood out... from what I wanted.
Bought a bouquet of flowers for my date, but they were wilted by the time I handed them over. Still appreciated the gesture.
Attempted to do a magic trick at a party, but it failed spectacularly. Still, everyone applauded my effort.
Tried to flirt with someone at the gym, but tripped on the treadmill and face-planted. Still gym buddies now.
Wore a bright Hawaiian shirt to a formal event to stand out. They certainly stood out... from the dress code.
Attempted to dance salsa at a party, but stepped on someone's foot instead. Now I'm known as the 'Foot Stealer'.
Wore mismatched socks to a job interview to show my quirky side. They noticed and it was not a good first impression.
Bought a 'funny' costume for Halloween, but it was too revealing. Spent the night hiding behind doorways.
Tried to be smooth and offer my seat on the bus, but ended up sitting on their bag instead. Awkward.
Wore a flashy belt to a dinner date to show my style, but it was too flashy and distracted from the conversation.
Tried to serenade my crush with a guitar song, but forgot the lyrics and ended up singing nonsense. She laughed and gave me a thumbs up.
Spilled wine all over myself during a fancy dinner date. It was a sticky situation!
Accidentally walked into the women's restroom while my phone was playing a loud romantic song. Stayed for a minute before realizing.
